Hi Ian,

This is a well known problem. The way to solve it, using Heritrix =
1.x, is to create an override for the domain (e.g. domain.com) and override=
 the 'force-queue-assignment' setting on the 'frontier'. This will cause th=
is domain and all of its subdomains to be added to the same politeness queu=
e (instead of each subdomain getting its own). Typically I use the domain n=
ame (e.g. domain.com) as the override value.

You might also loosen the pol=
iteness settings a bit on this override if you deem that the site can handl=
e it, now that there will only be one hit at a time.

In Heritrix 3.x, this=
 is a bit different. Per domain overrides have been replaced with a differe=
nt mechanism and you'll have to create a separate 'sheet overlay' for each =
of these domains and apply the corresponding configuration change (see queu=
eAssignmentPolicy in the cxml).

To make things easier for myself, I create=
d a variant on the SurtAuthorityQueueAssignmentPolicy that allows me to spe=
cify a maximum number of domain levels to include in the queue name. Using =
this I only have to have one single sheet overlay and map all the problem d=
omains to this overlay. This makes for a much cleaner cxml if you have many=
 such problem domains.

- Kris
